items.title: How I Built A $1M/Year Business - And Helped My Parents Retire

ai.summary: Based on the available description, when he was 15 Tuan Le vowed to help his parents retire after his family emigrated from Vietnam to Toronto in 2015. Ten years later his social video production company, ShortsCut, is generating over $1 million USD a year in sales, and he now covers his parents' rent and living expenses so they no longer have to work full time.
bullets: Tuan Le pledged at 15 to help his parents after emigrating from Vietnam to Toronto in 2015.
He founded ShortsCut, a social video production company.
ShortsCut now brings in over $1 million USD in annual sales.
Tuan uses his business income to pay his parents' rent and living expenses.
Video produced by CNBC Make It with credited production team members.
takeaways: Growing social video businesses can scale to significant revenue, implying steady demand for reliable digital infrastructure and bandwidth.
Content production companies may require scalable, low-latency services as they grow‚Äîimportant when planning capacity and regional edge deployments.
Local success stories (e.g., Toronto-based creators) highlight the value of urban data center presence and connectivity for supporting creative industries.
